conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the pedestrian and the bus using the given velocity-time (v-t) graphs.
The pedestrian runs at a constant speed of 8 m/s.
The pedestrian starts 36 meters behind the bus.
The bus starts from rest and accelerates uniformly, reaching a speed of 8 m/s at t = 8 seconds.
The acceleration of the bus is calculated as 1 m/s².
The distance covered by the pedestrian in time t is 8t.
The distance covered by the bus in time t is 0.5t².
The pedestrian catches up with the bus when 8t = 0.5t² + 36.
Rearrange to form a quadratic equation: 0.5t² - 8t + 36 = 0.
Solve the quadratic equation using the quadratic formula.
The discriminant is negative, indicating no real solutions for t.
Since there are no real solutions, the pedestrian cannot catch up with the bus.
